sapia:sect-desc.p: Use this rule to ensure that a given object property/attribute is not null.

Specifies the name of the accessor whose return value must not be null.
If this attribute is omitted, the current object on the validation context's stack will be validated.
This attribute's value must use the property access notation specified by the BeanUtils libary - see the library's javadoc for more information.

sapia:sect3.title: Ensuring that all employees have a name

sapia:code.content:
<vlad xmlns:vlad="http://www.sapia-oss.org/vlad/rules">
<ruleSet id="checkCompany">
<vlad:forEach attribute="employees"> <ruleSet id="checkEmployee"> <vlad:mandatory attribute="name" id="employeeName"> <message value="Employee does not have a name"/> </vlad:mandatory> </ruleSet> </vlad:forEach>
</ruleSet>
</vlad>
